ratings.comment: I Took ILS 367 with Professor Botero. She is the best professor I've had; super caring, passionate, and enjoys teaching her students. She is a very good literary analyst and explains difficult concepts between texts with ease. Be ready to read books, attend every discussion section, and participate in discussions by asking and answering questions.

I took ILS 367 (Migration in the Americas) in F24 with her. She is super passionate about what she teaches and the course material is always unexpectedly insightful. Her lectures are delivered with thematic clarity and always end on a conclusive note. She makes you think about the hidden details in passages that may otherwise not have been noticed.
She is very sweet and you can tell she cares a lot. Very easy class with generally clear expectations. Participation is important.

One of the best prof I have had here. She is super energetic and passionate about her lectures, and you can really tell that she is aiming for the best for her students. The course material is interesting, and the lectures are structured so that we get to share our experiences and thoughts throughout the semester.

Botero is a great professor. She makes lectures very interesting and you can tell she genuinely cares about her students. There is quite a bit of reading, so be prepared for that. Otherwise, the courseload is quite manageable. There is a presentation, essay, and final exam but she gives very flexible deadlines and provides clear instructions.

~ Disregard last review
(Spring 2021-2022: ILS 371 - Sex, drugs, and Literature) As a lit class, there's a bit of reading but usually below p. 40 before lecture. Readings are easy to follow & interesting. She uses a mixture of movies & readings. Most readings she provides. There is essays, midterm, & final. Tests are mini essays with prompts.

(Spring 2021-2022) As a lit class, there's a bit of reading but usually below p. 40 before lecture. Readings are easy to follow & interesting. She uses a mixture of movies & readings. Most readings she provides. There is essays, midterm, & final. Tests are mini essays with prompts.

Beatriz is the best professor at UW! She cares so much about her students both in class and out of class. She is extremely knowledgable and culturally fluent. You would be making a huge mistake not to take her class! Only criticism I can give is she doesn't put grades in canvas and there is a lot of reading required (but it is very interesting).

Do not recommend. Grading criteria was extremely unclear. Loads of reading for each week/class. Was told we could have 3 excused absences that would not affect our grade just to find out that its not true. (Missed 2 classes due to illness, told the TA, and still did not get full points for my attendance)

Professor Botero is one of the sweetest, most passionate professors I have ever had here at the university; she really tries to get to know all of her students. Make sure you are familiar with all the readings, otherwise your participation grade & exams may suffer. If you do the work and provide your own honest opinions, it's an easy A!
An awesome professor and a really nice human being. Take class with her if you can, she is really nice and sweet. She knows her content.

I had Beatriz for both 226 and 224, and she is THE best TA ever. She's adorable and fun, and it's clear that she loves teaching. If you're having trouble, she's more than willing to help, and she always tries her hardest to keep class interesting. I would definitely recommend taking her!

Beatriz is adorable! She is super funny and sweet. Not too much homework, 4 exams and 4 papers (which you can correct and hand back in). She can't explain grammar concepts very well in english, but if you have a background in Spanish you'll be fine. Take Beatriz!
Awesome teacher! I looked forward to Spanish everyday with her. Easy grader and she will do whatever it takes to help you. She is very genuine and is one of the best teachers I've had so far!
Beatriz is so adorable. Her class is relatively easy, only studying is vocab etc. Spanish wasn't bad considering it was 4 days a week.

She was a very good teacher. Spoke very clear and comprehensible Spanish.  I thought I would have a lot harder of a transition into a college language but she made it fun and easy.  Was very patient and helpful to students.  She was very fun. I wish I could've had her again.
good teacher. easiest 4 credit class i have taken so far. definately worth the time.
